intro: Homalium humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
